p: Organic solvents were used in this study for extraction, as these have been reported to result in higher antibacterial activity compared with aqueous extract.[ 30] Acetone has been reported to be highly effective for extraction, as it dissolves a wide range of active compounds from plants including both hydrophilic and hydrophobic components.[ 31 32] In addition, the use of organic solvent as an extractant does not confer any negative effect on the bioactivity against the bacteria tested.[ 33]
